senses.sense_definition: Relating to the <w>uvula</w>, the small fleshy piece of tissue hanging at the back of the throat.

examples.text: The doctor examined the patient's throat for any signs of <w>uvular</w> swelling.
Severe snoring can sometimes be caused by <w>uvular</w> vibration.

senses.sense_definition: Describing a speech sound produced by the back of the tongue touching or approaching the <w>uvula</w>.

examples.text: Standard French typically uses a <w>uvular</w> trill for the letter R.
She practiced the <w>uvular</w> fricative to improve her German pronunciation.

senses.sense_definition: A consonant sound articulated with the back of the tongue against the <w>uvula</w>.

examples.text: Many learners find it difficult to distinguish between velars and <w>uvulars</w>.
The language is known for its complex system of <w>uvulars</w>.
